14 
15 // a bounding volume hierarchy, cf. C. Garth and K. I. Joy:
16 // “Fast, memory-efficient cell location in unstructured grids for visualization”,
17 // IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics, vol. 16, no. 6, pp. 1541–1550, 2010.
18 
19 template<size_t IndexSize, int NumDimensions>
20 struct CelltreeNode;
21 
22 typedef CelltreeNode<sizeof(Index),1> CelltreeNode1;
23 typedef CelltreeNode<sizeof(Index),2> CelltreeNode2;
24 typedef CelltreeNode<sizeof(Index),3> CelltreeNode3;
25 
26 V_DECLARE_SHMREF(CelltreeNode1)
27 V_DECLARE_SHMREF(CelltreeNode2)
28 V_DECLARE_SHMREF(CelltreeNode3)
29 
30 template<typename Scalar, typename Index, int NumDimensions=3>
31 class V_COREEXPORT Celltree: public Object {
32  V_OBJECT(Celltree);
33 
34  public:
35  typedef Object Base;
36 
37  typedef typename VistleScalarVector<NumDimensions>::type Vector;
38  typedef CelltreeNode<sizeof(Index), NumDimensions> Node;
39 
40  class VisitFunctor {
41 
42  public:
43  enum Order {
44  None = 0, //< none of the subnodes have to be visited
45  RightFirst = 1, //< right subnode has to be visited, should be visited first
46  RightSecond = 2, //< right subnode has to be visited, should be visited last
47  Left = 4, //< left subnode has to be visited
48  Right = RightFirst, //< right subnode has to be visited
49  LeftRight = Left|RightSecond, //< both subnodes have to be visited, preferably left first
50  RightLeft = Left|RightFirst, //< both subnodes have to be visited, preferably right first
51  };
52 
54  bool checkBounds(const Scalar *min, const Scalar *max) {
55 
56  (void)min;
57  (void)max;
58  return true; // continue traversal
59  }
60 
62  Order operator()(const Node &node) {
63 
64  (void)node;
65  return LeftRight;
66  }
67  };
68 
70  class LeafFunctor {
71  public:
72  bool operator()(Index elem) {
73  return true; // continue traversal
74  }
75  };
76 
78  class CellBoundsFunctor {
79  public:
80  bool operator()(Index elem, Vector *min, Vector *max) {
81  return false; // couldn't compute bounds
82  }
83  };
84 
85  Celltree(const Index numCells,
86  const Meta &meta=Meta());
87 
88  void init(const Vector *min, const Vector *max, const Vector &gmin, const Vector &gmax);
89  void refine(const Vector *min, const Vector *max, Index nodeIdx, const Vector &gmin, const Vector &gmax);
90  template<class BoundsFunctor>
91  bool validateTree(BoundsFunctor &func) const;
92 
93  Scalar *min() { return &(d()->m_bounds)[0]; }
94  const Scalar *min() const { return &(d()->m_bounds)[0]; }
95  Scalar *max() { return &(d()->m_bounds)[NumDimensions]; }
96  const Scalar *max() const { return &(d()->m_bounds)[NumDimensions]; }
97  typename shm<Node>::array &nodes() { return *d()->m_nodes; }
98  const typename shm<Node>::array &nodes() const { return *d()->m_nodes; }
99  typename shm<Index>::array &cells() { return *d()->m_cells; }
100  const typename shm<Index>::array &cells() const { return *d()->m_cells; }
101 
102  template<class InnerNodeFunctor, class ElementFunctor>
103  void traverse(InnerNodeFunctor &visitNode, ElementFunctor &visitElement) const {
104  if (!visitNode.checkBounds(min(), max()))
105  return;
106  traverseNode(0, nodes().data(), cells().data(), visitNode, visitElement);
107  }
108 
109  private:
110  template<class BoundsFunctor>
111  bool validateNode(BoundsFunctor &func, Index nodenum, const Vector &min, const Vector &max) const;
112  template<class InnerNodeFunctor, class ElementFunctor>
113  bool traverseNode(Index curNode, const Node *nodes, const Index *cells, InnerNodeFunctor &visitNode, ElementFunctor &visitElement) const {
114 
115  const Node &node = nodes[curNode];
116  if (node.isLeaf()) {
117  for (Index i = node.start; i < node.start+node.size; ++i) {
118  const Index cell = cells[i];
119  if (!visitElement(cell))
120  return false;
121  }
122  return true;
123  }
124 
125  const typename VisitFunctor::Order order = visitNode(node);
126  assert(!((order&VisitFunctor::RightFirst) && (order&VisitFunctor::RightSecond)));
127  bool continueTraversal = true;
128  if (continueTraversal && (order & VisitFunctor::RightFirst)) {
129  continueTraversal = traverseNode(node.child+1, nodes, cells, visitNode, visitElement);
130  }
131  if (continueTraversal && (order & VisitFunctor::Left)) {
132  continueTraversal = traverseNode(node.child, nodes, cells, visitNode, visitElement);
133  }
134  if (continueTraversal && (order & VisitFunctor::RightSecond)) {
135  continueTraversal = traverseNode(node.child+1, nodes, cells, visitNode, visitElement);
136  }
137 
138  return continueTraversal;
139  }
140 
141  template<class Functor>
142  bool traverseNode(Index curNode, Functor &func) const;
143 
144  V_DATA_BEGIN(Celltree);
145  Scalar m_bounds[NumDimensions*2];
146  ShmVector<Index> m_cells;
147  ShmVector<Node> m_nodes;
148 
149  static Data *create(const std::string &name="", const Index numCells = 0,
150  const Meta &m=Meta());
151  Data(const std::string &name = "", const Index numCells = 0,
152  const Meta &m=Meta());
153  V_DATA_END(Celltree);
154 };
155

163 extern template class V_COREEXPORT Celltree<Scalar, Index, 3>;

174  public:
175  typedef vistle::Celltree<Scalar, Index, Dim> Celltree;

vistle::Celltree::VisitFunctor::checkBounds
bool checkBounds(const Scalar *min, const Scalar *max)
check whether the celltree is within bounds min and max, otherwise no traversal
